course_title: Special Topics in Women's, Gender and Sexuality Studies: Monsters, Vampires, & Cyborgs
class_notes:
The word monster shares a root with both to demonstrate and to warn.  What do monsters demonstrate to us about ourselves? What do they warn us of? How do different societies decide what is monstrous and who is excluded or feared as a result?
 
This course will look at depictions of monsters in literature, film, and cultural theory--from Dracula and King Kong to cyborgs and zombies. Through an intersectional feminist lens, we'll explore the ways in which these texts depict ideas and fears about gendered and racialized others and we'll examine ways in which those who have been branded as monstrous have seized control of their own narratives, often through re-telling monster stories from a different perspective.
